number of helpful: 30 of 32 people (94%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 1
												The negative Steam reviews here are mostly about the technical issues, but my problem is with the game itself. It's a competent little city builder with a nice art-direction and animations, but the gameplay is unfortunately just too simple, repetitive and unchallenging, especially if compared to the previous Settlers titles. It's not a bad game, just "too casual". Definitely enjoyable for many, especially younger gamers, gamers with lives or those who actually prefer the simplicity.

number of helpful: 28 of 29 people (97%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: February 28, 2016
												The Settlers - Rise of an Empire is one of my favorite RTS games and it is a prominent part of the game series.I am the "builder type", and this game lets me play my style: mine all the resources, upgrade everything, create the biggest army possible and crush the enemy. After the overcomplicated The Settlers - Heritage of Kings this may look too simple, because you only need to care a few basic things to run the economy well. The game also took away the control of the settlers, you only can move your army and your hero. I like the idea to place a building, and the people will do their work automatically. It's logic: if I place a mine, I would create miners anyway. You still can explore the map with the hero of your choice, they both have passive and active capabilities. The game is well balanced, looks beautiful IMO and I also purchased the OST because it is a masterpiece. The multiplayer is completely dead, but it still worth buying because of the campaign, it has a great story. I could play hours on each map and with the Gold Edition you also get the expansion. 10/10 would buy again.

number of helpful: 20 of 22 people (91%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 30, 2014
												Adore this game except for the thieves. They get caught very easily and the enemy thieves always manage to avoid my guards somehow. On the plus side, I really love building up my little towns to bustling cities and going out to claim land for my kingdom. I don't see the point of the citizens getting married, as it doesn't seem to affect population in any way, but if it keeps them happy, I'm willing to throw a festival every now and then. I think this game has a great blend of strategy and warfare coupled with governing a town. Overall, I really like this game.

												Rise of an Empire is my favorite release from the Settlers series. From the resource gathering to surviving harsh winters to creating armies & conquering territories, this game does it all very well. There is much to do within the game including multiplayer, custom scenarios and a rather intruiging caimpaign.  If you are a true City Builder/Strategy fan, I highly recommend this classic.

content:

												Updated: I was able to up the amount on default video memory thru the BIOS to 512MB. This has allowed me to play the game now.  If you are a well versed computer user running windows 8 then you should be able to manage this fix. If not i would stear away from this great game until a fix is released to the masses. 20 Dollars down the Drain. I really was looking forward into getting back into this game played it allot back when it came out.  Well after installation when I went to run it I was unable to even load into the game. I constantly recieve a memory issue. This was the first and last time i will not check the forums before a purchase of an older title.  It looks to be an issue to do with windows 8 and any video card over 2gigs of memory. If they fix this i look forward to enjoying this game as I did in the past. If not i only hope they will refund those of us whom cannot run this game on a newer system. They should also put some kind of warning into the description so newer users do not run into this issue.

content:
Posted: April 20, 2012
												The original? Fun. Fun, fun, fun, fun. Great Stratagy game: fluid game play, looks good, a good hearty amount of castle sim with albeit sloppy, chunky, painful, but "bearable" combat. A definate play atleast once, but it falls very short of what the they "said" it would be. The Expansion? Dumb. Stupid. Actually gets RID of content. Adds very little. Gets rid of "Free play mode." There's almost no online community and the two games are seperate of each other and there isn't any map editor provided.Overall? An on sale purchase. It's really good, but why would anyone buy an expansion that TAKES AWAY content? Horrible. Dumb. Stupid.

content:
Posted: January 1, 2015
												Don't buy this game if you plan to play it on a Laptop.Most gaming laptops have 2 graphics cards.If your BIOS doesn't let you disable the integrated one completely you can't play Settlers 6.Setting the right graphics card in the graphics card software will on some laptops (f.e. MSI Gaming Series) for some reason not do the trick.Otherwise you will only get an error popup that tells you that your graphics card has less than 70 MB Memory, because it automatically uses the onboard graphics chip wich has of course no own memory at all, but uses shared one.Thank you Ubisoft for another dumb annoying thing... As if your DRM Addiction wouldn't be enough pain in the ***.

number of helpful: 6 of 8 people (75%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 29, 2016
												You are mostly gathering resources, growing your settlement, expanding your territory, and fulfilling various scenario tasks, all within a usually very creative map that includes valleys, river crossing, mountain passes, and other fun strategic stuff. Maybe half of the scenarios end with you destroying another faction, but this is definitely not a military-focused game.The good:-Very solid game engine: never a bug or crash after 5 months of playing on Windows Vista 64-bit with a GeForce 9800GTX and graphics settings maxed-out-Immersive period graphics and another solid ambient period music score by Dynamedion (Best German Soundtrack 2007)-Creative maps/scenarios that are generally not too difficult and typically take around 3 hours each-Vegetarian rating allows you to replay old maps using a different strategy-Active user community creating custom maps for youCons:-Somewhat restrictive camera angle-Less complex than other similar games (Anno 1701), although what it lacks in complexity in the game engine, I'd say it makes up for in the variation and creativity of the maps/scenarios.

content:
Posted: November 24, 2016
												I keep coming back and replaying this game as a fun little building game. The missions are relaxing and you feel like you're actually building a community in each map. The people have personality and your heroes are (often) useful. Combat is simplistic but satisfying. The story is solid enough without being melodramatic. Runs solid as a rock. I also enjoy the map variety. It's a great game!

number of helpful: 3 of 3 people (100%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: October 13, 2016
												Played this 8 years ago when I was a young kid. Bought it a week ago on Steam. Had to cry because it reminded me of my childhood.Its a very good game. The graphics are wonderful for its release date (April 2008). The Settlers 5 was more like an military simulation but Settlers 6 brought back the wonderful Settler feeling, also introducing territories which make the game more complex and even better. The mechanics are nice, but the settler limit and the military limit is a little low, making it difficult to conquer enemy bases sometimes. It features 3 military units: Swordsmen, Archer and siege machines, which are divided into siege rams, siege towers and catapults, each of them featuring a special ability (Rams are effective against gates, etc...).All in all it was a great game when it was released and is still a nice game. Performance is also great (I run it at 3000fps :D)!I would totally recommend buying this if you like the "the settler"-series!

												im not like most who have played this during the early days of it being out and so on but i wanted to see what all the fus was about and wanted to start my settlers jurney with this one and omgggggggg for frik say is it addictive and amazing. now i wouldn't recommend playing for more then 4hours start might get abit repetitive so give your self brakes. but yeah my only words are OMG for an old game it has so much more to offer then most now a days games that are city builder/rts'ish games. for more indepth reviews their are lots around, i just wanted to quickly sum it up.

												This is a very easy going game a nice change of pace from the high speed castle build games. The only downside is that there isn't enough people to fight or the computer isn't hard enough, then there's the maps but that can be over looked in my opinion it's just a good game
